greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Compound filter (prime signature of n & prime signature of n+d(n)): a(n) = P(A046523(n), A286479(n)), where P(n,k) is sequence A000027 used as a pairing function and d(n) is number of divisors of n (A000005).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pairing Function
mathematica: f[n_] := If[n == 1, 1, Times @@ MapIndexed[Prime[First[#2]]^#1 &, Sort[FactorInteger[n][[All, -1]], Greater]]]; Table[(2 + (#1 + #2)^2 - #1 - 3 #2)/2 & @@ {f@ n, f[n + DivisorSigma[0, n]]}, {n, 80}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 21 2017 *)
program: A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ This function from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 17 2011
def T(n, m): return ((n + m)**2 - n - 3*m + 2)/2
return sorted([f[i] for i in f])
def a(n): return T(a046523(n), a286479(n)) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 21 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 21 2017
